messages: 73c5a25f18e5ff8b6e5bb2e35aea9e3d (16:04): Present+ Wonsuk_Lee
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:05): Topic: Review and tweak agenda

4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:05): AB: the draft agenda was posted yesterday ( http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-webapps/2010JulSep/0447.html ). The two specs on the agenda are Widget Interface and the Widget URI scheme. Any change requests?
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:05): RT: I would like to talk about Widget Updates spec
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:05): AB: ok, will add that to the end of the meeting
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:06): Topic: Announcements
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:06): AB: any short announcements today?
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:06): Topic: TWI spec: Action-568
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:06): AB: earlier this week discussion on openURL removal continued ( http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-webapps/2010JulSep/0394.html )
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:07): AB: Bryan Sullivan had some comments
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:07): ... I was hoping Bryan would join today but he hasn't
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:07): AB: I believe Marcos position is very clear
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:07): ... he wants it removed from the spec
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:08): RB: as far as I am concerned, agree it is useful
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:08): ... but it is also problematic
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:08): ... Think it should be solved somewhere else
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:08): RT: yes, there is a complexity issue here
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:08): ... so I agree with Marcos and Robin
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:09): RB: if we remove it, we should be able to go straight to REC
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:09): AB: we could go to PR but not REC because of some dependency issues
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:09): RB: dependency on HTML5?
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:09): AB: yes that is one
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:10): AB: I also tend to agree with the arguments to remove the functionality
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:10): ... and defer to some other spec for equivalent functionality
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:11): AB: I'll start an explict CfC about removing this method from the spec
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:11): ... I'd like to make sure everyone has an opportunity to state their position
88ef4ffb265c9d83a0dd918325d14bb0 (16:11): yep, sounds good
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:11): ACTION: barstow start a CfC about openURL and Action-568
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (16:11): noticed an ACTION. Trying to create it.
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (16:11): Created ACTION-569 - Start a CfC about openURL and Action-568 [on Arthur Barstow - due 2010-08-19].
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:11): AB: anything else on that topic for today?
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:12): Topic: URI Scheme spec
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:12): AB: it has been a while since we discussed the widget: scheme spec ( http://dev.w3.org/cvsweb/2006/waf/widgets-uri/ )
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:12): AB: what's the status and plan?
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:12): RB: I still need to address some issues
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:12): ... I plan to make it a priority
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:13): ... hope to finish by the end of the month
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:13): ... I know the action items
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:13): AB: ok, great
88ef4ffb265c9d83a0dd918325d14bb0 (16:14): nothing to report on that point
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:14): AB: does anyone have any implementation status for this spec?
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:14): RB: I found it easy to implement
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:14): AB: the spec says authors shouldn't use this scheme
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:14): ... so what's the use case
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:15): RB: when using the DOM, need to determine an absolute URI
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:15): ... so impls need it
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:15): ... it could also to lead to security hole if an implementor was to use something like a file: URI
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:15): ... at runtime it is needed
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:15): ... e.g. to reuse a web runtime engine
88ef4ffb265c9d83a0dd918325d14bb0 (16:16): It's a very useful spec and I believe we require it for impl. down the line.
88ef4ffb265c9d83a0dd918325d14bb0 (16:16): ...at Opera
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:16): AB: anything else on that spec?
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:16): RT: we use it for some projects
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:16): ... good to get rid of the file: issue
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:17): Topic: Widget Updates spec
88ef4ffb265c9d83a0dd918325d14bb0 (16:17): widgets updates: http://dev.w3.org/2006/waf/widgets-updates/
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:17): RT: I've been working with Marcos on this spec
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:17): ... clarified update description
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:18): ... started an alogorithm to do the update
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:18): ... would like to get some feedback
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:18): AB: I haven't looked at the changes
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:18): RB: same here although I will do so shortly
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:19): RT: addresses comparing signatures for the installed widget and the update widget
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:19): ... so please do take a look
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:19): AB: to get broader review, it often helps to publish a new version
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:20): AB: when will it be ready for a new pub?
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:20): RT: I have another couple of weeks of work to do before it is ready
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:20): AB: ok, that sounds good
88ef4ffb265c9d83a0dd918325d14bb0 (16:20): I want to clarify the Verification Process as it is largely just a placeholder at present
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:21): AB: perhaps we can put it on the agenda for the next call which is probably in 2 weeks
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:21): RT: any feedback now would be good
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:21): AB: I'll ask for internal review
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:22): AB: are there some existing protocols this functionality could be layered on?
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:22): ... e.g. the DM stuff from OMA
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:23): RT: yes, there is some existing work to consider
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:23): ... if you have related feedback, that would be useful
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:25): AB: anything else on Updates spec for today?
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:25): RT: not from me
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:25): Topic: AoB
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:25): AB: anything else for today?
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:25): AB: the bulk of the remaining work for the widget specs is test cases
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:26): ... and it is great to see that Opera is contributing in that area
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:26): ... e.g. DigSig tests and WARP tests
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:27): AB: next call will be August 26 if there is something to discuss otherwise, September 2
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:27): AB: let's continue to use public-webapps so that we can eliminate and/or shorten our voice conferences
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:27): AB: meeting adjourned
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:28): RRSAgent, make minutes
